The claim is supported by multiple books: including "Energy for Future Presidents" and a post on a Quora thread.
The United States government has a rule: natural" materials, ruling out alcohol made from petroleum.
The United States Bureau of Alcohol: Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) has a reliable test to differentiate between natural alcohol and alcohol made from petroleum - checking for radioactivity.
Natural alcohol derived from plants is r: while synthetic alcohol derived from petroleum is not radioactive due to being isolated from the radioactive atmosphere.
